image.altText: Close-up of man

props.synopsis: The court decision comes after the former SAS soldier's civil case against Nine Entertainment was dismissed in June, prompting a complicated battle over legal costs.

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith ordered to pay indemnity costs for entirety of his failed defamation case

image.altText: Lighting strike during morning thunderstorm overlooking Morphett Vale in Adelaide, fence at bottom, trees to the side

props.synopsis: The system already dumped a month's worth of rain in an hour on parts of Adelaide on Tuesday morning, and is now heading towards the eastern states.

title.children: Supercell storms to bring 'violent winds' and potential floods to eastern parts of Australia

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walks into court.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann has now been on the stand for four days being questioned about the night Brittany Higgins alleges she was raped and the media coverage which followed it.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann tells court he believes Brittany Higgins's fiance sent him threatening email titled 'Coming for you'

image.altText: A screencap of CCTV footage showing the moment a bus started moving towards a petrol station at Casino, NSW.

props.synopsis: The 14-year-old girl from Casino High School, who was sitting on the bus with about 20 others, sprung into action when she noticed it moving without anybody in the driver's seat, narrowly preventing what could have been a major disaster.

title.children: Quick thinking teenage girl saves runaway bus from crashing into New South Wales petrol station

image.altText: Old photos of a car that has been in a crash.

props.synopsis: The crash investigator tells an inquest there was "something not right" about the initial investigation into the 1987 crash in regional NSW.

title.children: Former detective tells inquest police failed to test 'critical evidence' in deaths of teenage cousins

image.altText: HMAS Toowoomba

props.synopsis: The warning comes in the wake of a confrontation between Australian frigate HMAS Toowoomba and a Chinese warship, which left two Australian divers with minor injuries.

title.children: Australian Navy vessels need to act 'with prudence' in waters near China, top Chinese official says

image.altText: aerial shot of housing in NSW

props.synopsis: The state government hopes the sweeping change will allow another 112,000 homes to be built in councils across Greater Sydney, the Hunter, Central Coast and Illawarra.

title.children: Some NSW homeowners will hit new hurdles when objecting townhouses, units next door

image.altText: Woman in a white and blue dress with her hands on her hips standing next to a man in a black t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Gus Kuster was being held in indefinite detention until three weeks ago. Now released and fitted with a monitoring ankle bracelet, he says he still doesn't feel free.

title.children: Gus has been released from detention and fitted with an ankle bracelet. He wants you to know his story

image.altText: Tree branch through headrest

props.synopsis: A group of girls were returning to their accommodation along one of K'gari's sand tracks when a tree branch smashed the windscreen and speared through a passenger seat headrest.

title.children: Schoolies group lucky to be alive after tree branch smashes through windscreen

image.altText: An employee of DP World walking along the Melbourne wharves

props.synopsis: After a cyber attack shut down Australia's largest ports operator earlier in November, DP World Australia has confirmed that current and former employees have had their data stolen by an unidentified third party.

title.children: DP World confirms personal employee data was stolen during cyber attack

image.altText: The stump of a felled tree at Lane Cove with a person in khaki visible in the background

props.synopsis: Another mass killing of trees and plants has taken place in Longueville on Sydney's lower north shore, just months after more than 200 were cut down in a nearby suburb.

title.children: Mass tree killing on Sydney Harbour is 'worst act of environmental vandalism' locals have seen

image.altText: A graphic of Tiny Pinder pictured against a dark background with a basketball and a newspaper clipping

props.synopsis: In the early 1990s, the Perth Wildcats were the sporting kings of the city. But that rockstar status may have helped a brutal sexual predator hide in plain sight. WARNING: This story contains details of child sexual abuse.

title.children: He was a star basketball player for the Perth Wildcats — and a brutal sex offender hiding in plain sight

image.altText: Dozens of natual disaster personell, dressed in orange gather around a tunnel, waiting for trapped workers to be rescued

props.synopsis: The process of pulling out all 41 miners, one at a time on wheeled stretchers through a pipe 90cm wide, will take a couple of hours according to officials.

title.children: Indian rescuers break through tunnel debris to evacuate 41 trapped workers

image.altText: A Bateau bay sign

props.synopsis: The woman in her 90s had been residing in a Bateau Bay aged care home where police allege she was attacked by a 34-year-old man.

title.children: Elderly woman dies almost two weeks after alleged nursing home sex assault

image.altText: An Indigenous Australian man stands outside a building looking happy.

props.synopsis: The WA Premier makes an official apology in parliament on behalf of the state to Aboriginal people, who worked for little or no pay for decades.

title.children: WA government says sorry to Indigenous people for decades of discriminatory work practices, stolen wages

image.altText: A man wearing all black walks along a line of other men, also wearing black.

props.synopsis: Performing the Nazi salute will become a criminal offence in Australia, as the federal government seeks to counter rising outbreaks of anti-Semitism and racism.

title.children: Federal government moves to ban Nazi salute after spike in anti-Semitism, racism

image.altText: High Court of Australia

props.synopsis: Responding to the full reasons of the High Court published today, the home affairs minister says the government is finalising a "preventative detention regime" for detainees who were ordered released from indefinite immigration detention.

title.children: Government to introduce 'tough' preventative detention for detainees released by High Court order

image.altText: Pat Cummins smiling during an interview.

props.synopsis: Since taking over the Australian cricket captaincy, Pat Cummins has been outspoken on social issues, sparking backlash and claims from critics that he had become "too woke". But he says he feels emboldened by the negative responses.

title.children: 'I know who I am': Pat Cummins on refusing to pander to a 'loud minority'

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: Federal parliament pays tribute to the son of SA's police commissioner, with the prime minister describing the 18-year-old as the "bright and beloved heart of a universe" and the opposition leader overcome by emotion as he read the letter penned by the alleged hit-and-run victim's parents.

title.children: 'Beloved heart of a universe': Charlie Stevens eulogised by prime minister as opposition leader breaks down

image.altText: Man on boat holding a fish

props.synopsis: The family of Matthew Balange has thanked emergency services for their search and rescue efforts on the Sunshine Coast, saying "without them, we would not have the shreds of hope that we have clung to during this time".

title.children: Family of missing fisher describe a beloved 'partner, son, dad' as hopes fade of finding him alive

image.altText: People walk past an Optus store in Sydney.

props.synopsis: In written answers to Senate questions on notice, Optus has confirmed it has paid compensation in cash to customers affected by its nationwide outage on November 8, after being slammed for originally only offering extra data.

title.children: Optus begins compensating customers with cash over nationwide outage after earlier offer of extra data

image.altText: The cover of Sports Illustrated Super Bowl LVII commemorative issue.

props.synopsis: American magazine Sports Illustrated denies it used content created by artificial intelligence after it was accused of publishing articles by fake authors with AI-generated headshots.

title.children: 'This person does not exist': Sports Illustrated magazine denies using AI-generated authors for website content

image.altText: suburban street

props.synopsis: Two teenagers have been refused bail for a second time after they were charged over a group brawl that left a woman with critical injuries.

title.children: Street brawl where mother was stabbed planned on Snapchat, court hears as teens refused bail

image.altText: Minjee Lee looks on as she completes a shot

props.synopsis: Minjee Lee is enjoying the family banter with in-form brother Min Woo and feeling at ease as she once again chases an elusive Australian Open triumph to crown another stellar season.

title.children: Minjee Lee says Australian Open glory — not sibling rivalry — driving her in Sydney

image.altText: Clare O'Neil looks down as she walks from the despatch box in the House of Representative

props.synopsis: The federal government is refusing to say why it opted against imposing ankle monitoring bracelets on three of the people released into the community following a landmark High Court ruling.

title.children: Detainees released from immigration detention without ankle monitoring devices

image.altText: A woman and a man hugging, crying.

props.synopsis: Plastic chairs as beds. Meals of bread and rice. Hours spent waiting for the bathroom. As former hostages return to Israel after seven weeks of Hamas captivity, information about the conditions of their confinement is emerging.

title.children: Irregular meals, benches as beds: As freed hostages return to Israel, details of their captivity emerge

image.altText: Man holding up middle finger.

props.synopsis: Jason Paul Hawkins tells a jury he ran into the bushes because he wanted "no part" in the plot to murder Newcastle grandmother Stacey Klimovitch.

title.children: Alleged hit man says he fled getaway car before grandmother was gunned down

image.altText: Mark Butler sitting back in a motorised wheelchair, looking pensive.

props.synopsis: New South Wales is the last of the states to make voluntary assisted dying legal, but the first to give free choice on administering drugs and a shorter wait time.

title.children: From today voluntary assisted dying will be allowed in NSW. Mark wants to be one of the first to access it

image.altText: Actress Rachel Zegler gives a sarcastic bow as Lucy Gray in the Hunger Games prequel.

props.synopsis: Uli grew up in post-war Germany, so the possibility of a Hunger Games like dystopia feels like "a very real thing". This is how the film's production designer tackled the prequel.

title.children: Nazi Germany's influence on the new Hunger Games film
